availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis L. Gardner (Caldwell County, farmer and state representative)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and state representative. North Carolina native. Married to Margaret Holinns on January 12, 1825. Married to Amanda Mcelwain on February 15, 1847. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in 1860. Served as member of Kentucky House of Representatives for Caldwell County from 1863 until his resignation in February 1866.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 779. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 810. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 39. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 25. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 81. Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1874), 108. Marriage Records. Kentucky Marriages (Richmond, Kentucky: Madison County Courthouse), film 000851644.
